description:
The only kart racer that doesn't pull its punches.

Use codes for a "plug-and-play" experience: 
gaster 		= skip tutorial
rouge's gallery 	= unlock (almost) all characters
Seriusley this is a best game for sonic

very addicting technical kart racer that grows on you as you play. difficulty curve is intense, but its still rewarding along the way with a copious amount of unlockables. only thing right now is that opengl is broken (for me at least) when trying to join multiplayer; its also glitched in singleplayer, but wont crash at least. software rendering is alright but just not my preferred way to experience this gem. cant wait to see whats in store for the future of ring racers.
The game definitely has an aggresive learning curve but it clicks quickly. And once it does it's peak kart racing. The ring system with the factoring in of elevation and momentum. yes,

Pretty good, tutorial makes the game out to be way more complicated than it is and could do with just getting rid of, unlocking stuff seems to only happen in single player and the AI is annoying, online the game is insanely fun

i am the BIGGEST ring racist around
also out fo all things that don't work on my jank fedora setup thanks to my nvidia card, this at the very least has been the one thing to work flawlessly
summary: I LOVE FAULTING PEOPLE BY PUSHING THEM

description: if you don't agree, you don't exist
summary: this is truly peak ring racing

description: Works great on linux. The turorial is a bit long but the way the game is described by the dev is the kart racer eqilivent of a fighting game. There's tells, mixups, and more. Maximilist game design. SRB2K is better than mario kart in my opinion, so give this game a try asap. Also great mod support
summary: Sequel to SRB2K deserves all the attention in the world

description: But seriously, ditch the tutorial and the annoying intro. I just wanted to quickly try out the game and I had to wait for what felt like eternity to be forced to check video, audio, profile, and then a tutorial. We know how to play a kart racer. Just spend 10 seconds explaining the buttons and we're ready!

With fantastic design and a wonderous amount of polish in almost every bit, it falls flat when actually doing the *racing* part. With loose controls with too many poorly tacked-on ideas that weigh down the overall experience. A tragedy, with this being the spiritual successor to Sonic Robo Blast 2 Kart, a game with the opposite issues. Hopefully they can remediate this later, but until then SRB2K is still up for download.
summary: A beautiful game held back by it's actual game

description: NYOOOOOOM VRMRRMRM VRRRRRRRRRRRRRR RRRRRRR NYOOOOOOOOOOOOM VROOOM VOMVO M VRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRR NYRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRR

Tourne bien, très complet.

Moins facile d'accès qu'un Mario Kart ou un SRB2 Kart. Très fun cependant.

What would be a superior version of the best kart racing game ever created from the best Sonic game ever created, itself developed on the engine of the best game ever created?

The result would be incredible, right? 
Well… It is. 🐱
